intro: Dalechampia panamensis, commonly known as the Panama champa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical environments, often found in humid lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
